critique: The document pertains to the authorization of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation to handle securities related to loans made to the Georgia and Florida Railway Company. It is an amendment to a previous executive order and directs that any money realized through this action be paid to the Secretary of the Treasury. The document does not directly address ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion. However, it touches upon economic regulation by authorizing the Reconstruction Finance Corporation to manage financial instruments related to a specific company.
